'[[Ice hockey]]' was introduced to the Olympic Games at the 1920 Summer Olympics
in Antwerp. The matches were played between April 23 and April 29, 1920. All
matches took place in the Palais de Glace d'Anvers (ice palace of Antwerp). The
rink measured 56 to 18 meters (165 to 58Â½ feet). All games were played with
seven players on each side, with the rover position being used. All medals were
decided by using the Bergvall system. The gold medalists were the Winnipeg
Falcons, representing Canada. The silver went to the United States and
Czechoslovakia took the bronze.
